references.paper_title: Controlling the false discovery rate: a practical and powerful approach to multiple testing
references.reason: This paper introduces the Benjamini-Hochberg procedure, a crucial statistical method used in Conformal Alignment to control the false discovery rate (FDR) when selecting trustworthy model outputs.

references.paper_title: Algorithmic learning in a random world
references.reason: This book is foundational to the theory of conformal prediction, which underpins the core methodology of Conformal Alignment, providing a distribution-free framework for uncertainty quantification.

This paper extends conformal prediction methods to regression problems, which is relevant to Conformal Alignment's application in assessing the alignment of model outputs that are not simply classifications.

references.paper_title: Selection by prediction with conformal p-values
references.reason: This paper introduces the framework of conformalized selection, a key building block of Conformal Alignment that enables the selection of units whose outputs meet a specified alignment criterion with guaranteed FDR control.

references.paper_title: MIMIC-CXR, a de-identified publicly available database of chest radiographs with free-text reports
references.reason: This paper introduces the MIMIC-CXR dataset, a crucial resource used in the paper's experiments on radiology report generation, providing a real-world application of Conformal Alignment.
